messages.subject: triathletes
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/14/03 9:38:18 AM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/14/03 9:38:18 AM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I think she's aspiring to be a 70 year old triathlete! I admire her and
you
for your training regimens... >>

Well save all of your admiration for her, really!! I am no where near her
level. I can't even think about doing an ironman at this point. Certainly
don't have the time to dedicate to that level of triathlon nor the
inclination.
I do sprint level triathlons....it's perfect for people that want to have a
normal life and do triathlon. The level she is at it would be nigh to
impossible for me to work part time and have a family. They'd never see me.
My training is anywhere from 1/2 hour to an hour on typical days.
Occasionally longer, especially when getting close to competition. But
nothing like those Ironwomen!!

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
